moves.1. c4: I never plaid the english opening
moves.1... e5 2. Nc3 Nc6: As I don't know the englsh opening, I follow the database
moves.10... a5: preventing further white developpement on the queen's wing
moves.11. Rb1 Nxe2+: I do not like that type of situation, the only goal of the following moves is to open the game without giving any advantage to white
moves.12. Qxe2 Bxe3 13. fxe3: White has a very strong center and a doublie edged f semi open file.
moves.13... d5: Still trading to weaken white's center
moves.17. exd5: Now white begins a center trading party
moves.17... Nxd5 18. Nxd5 Bxd5 19. Qe2: The situation is about equilibrated : black occupates the center but subject to attack, nobody on the c open file, white pawn structure is bad, material is equal
moves.20. dxe4 Rxe4: All the following moves are done to try to get the best position
moves.21. Rbd1 Qd6 22. Qd2 Rd8 23. Nd4 Rg4: Mistake, the plan was to attack the king with rook, bishop and queen but I oversaw the consequences of the next black moves
moves.24. Rf2 Qe5 25. Nf3 Qe4 26. Qd3 f6: to permit the black king to escape before launching the attack
moves.27. Qxe4 Rxe4: I saw at this point the consequences of the situation (the two rooks do not support eachother)
moves.28. Rfd2 b6 29. Rd2xd5 Rxd5 30. Rxd5: From now on black tries to get a draw and holded 25 more moves but lost anyway
